result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 2/6/19.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
**Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; but concurrent to case 14CF4550.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or controlled substances.
NO contact with any of the codefendasnt or Doctors in case 14CF4550.

Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
To use one pharmacy when filling prescriptions.  To notify agent before filling any prescriptions.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine sreens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis Edward Sprewer Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (49 pages) commencing 02/06/2015 PLEA & SENTENCING. received and filed.

Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in court with attorney Donald Crawford Dudley.  Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to case #14CF4550, credit for 112 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 2/6/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 2/6/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with any of the co-defendants or doctors in case #14CF4550
-Defendant is to use 1 pharmacy when filling prescriptions
-Defendant is to notify the agent before filling any prescriptions
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until hisr civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Donald Crawford Dudley in court, defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 3/12/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case scheduled for scheduling conference.  Attorney Dudley is sick with the flu today, and unable to appear.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 1/14/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Attorney Donald Crawford Dudley in court, defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.
Attorney Dudley has just been appointed and waiting for discovery.  Attorney Dudley will contact attorney Daugherty if he does not receive discovery this week.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 1/7/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Attorney Dudley can contact the court if he feels he needs a bail bond hearing.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Taylor withdrew on the last court date.  State's public defender's office needs more time to appoint counsel.  Case adjourned for status of counsel, and bail bond hearing on 12/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in court with attorney Robert L. Taylor.  Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Patricia Daugherty.  Defense Motion to Withdraw as counsel granted by the court due to conflict of interest.  Defendant wants to discuss Bail. Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel.  Bail Review will be discussed at next court date.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel and Bail Review Hearing in Branch 3.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert L. Taylor in court, defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel wants to withdraw as counsel due to conflict of interest in another case.  Case adjourned for Motion to Withdraw in Branch 3.  Defendant to be produced for next court hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel's motion to withdraw recieved and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Robert L. Taylor in court, defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 11/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No action taken today.  NO attorney appeared.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 10/28/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Clerk contacted public defender's office.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 10/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
No reply from surety or defendant.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) ad
Justice Point notice of closing due to non-compliance, received and filed.  aw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer not in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.  Attorney Eichenlaub appeared earlier.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.   Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia I Daugherty.
VIOLATION REPORT RECEIVED AND FILED.
Defendant tested positive for cocaine.
Defendant wishes to challenge the test.  No action taken at this time.  aw

Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has just received an offer.  Defense is trying to see if defendant can get into drug treatment court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Defendant to continue with Justice Point.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court takes no action on report dated 2/18/2014.  Court was advised defendant missed contact because of a funeral, and came in the next day.  Defendant tested negative for drugs.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed for missed office contact.  aw

Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel still needs to receive an offer from the state.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 2/24/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Student Intern William Berens under the supervision of  Antonella Aleman for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Curtis Edward Sprewer in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
